statement: Strict idempotency for LLM request creation will require deterministic request IDs or a mutex/unique constraint beyond the current composite index.
rationale: Current get-or-create relies on an index for de-duplication but is not a hard uniqueness constraint under concurrent inserts; deterministic IDs or explicit locks would harden guarantees.
keyAssumptions: Convex index queries are not enforced as unique constraints.
validationCriteria: Concurrent insert test does not create duplicates
critiquePoints: Convex transaction semantics may already prevent duplicates in practice; needs verification
questions: Is concurrency for the same identity possible in current scheduling flow?
